BPERIK:
{"pcode":"BPERIK","pname":"Black-Panther vs Erik ","pstmt":"

Black-Panther and Erik are playing following game: game starts with given positive integer N.

Consider another positive integer K , K = N at first turn of game otherwise K equals answer of previous turn. Both players will get one by one turn, in each turn player will select one integer M which will strictly less than K and greater than 1 such that M divides K, after he will divide K with M and game will keep running untill K can't be divided further, so if one can't divide K in his turn then his opponent will win the game.

Both Black-Panther and Erik are lazy to play game so they need help to make one program which will tell directly that who will win the game with given starting value of N, if both plays optimally.

can you help them ?


As Black-Panther is elder than Erik, he will take first turn.

 

","pinput":"

The first line of the input contains an integer T denoting the number of test cases.
Next T lines contains integer N.

","poutput":"

Print "Black-Panther" in new line if Black-Panther wins otherwise print "Erik" in new line.

","pconstrains":"

1 ≤ T ≤ 100000
1 ≤ N ≤ 1000000

","des":"Fight peacefully :)","tcin":"

2
4
6

","tcout":"

Black-Panther
Black-Panther

","explain":"

Test case 1: Black-Panther will select 2 and divides 4 by 2, so now in Erik's turn K=4/2 = 2 which can not be divided further ,so winner is Black-Panther.

 

"}
SUM:
{"pcode":"SUM","pname":"Zuri and Magical garden","pstmt":"

Zuri is the incharge of Magical garden of Wakanda. The flowers of this garden are important to retain ability of Black-Panther. There are many flowers in the garden and the strength of each flower is represented as number P. Zuri is very concerned about the security so  decided to store it. Numbers are stored by following method.

For each number P:
First he will generate one array(let us call array as A[1..n]) of n integers with sum of all element in array is P.
Now he will make two another array prefix and suffix of generated array.


prefix[1] = A[1]
for i=2 to n
prefix[i] = prefix[i-1] + A[i];

suffix[n] = A[n]
for i=n-1 to 1
suffix[i] = suffix[i+1] + A[i];

Now he will rotate these two array either left or right with same degree.
Ofcource,he doesn't want to remember degree of rotation of all arrays.
As he doesn't have degree of rotation, he want to make progrgam which can give private number directly.  
So can you help Black-Panther to get his numbers back.

","pinput":"

The first line contains T denoting number of flowers. For each test case First line contains integer n which is size of array. Next two lines contains n integers each.(First is rotated prefix array and Second is rotated suffix array)
Both are rotated by same degree. It is guaranteed that answer will be always possible and it will be unique for given test data.

","poutput":"

For each flower print strength of that flower in new line.

","pconstrains":"

1 ≤ T ≤ 5000
1 ≤ n ≤ 1000
-100 ≤ preffix[i],suffix[i] ≤ 100

","tcin":"

2
4
2 0 0 0
0 -2 0 0
3
1 1 1
1 0 0

","tcout":"

0
1

","explain":"

Test Case 1: The Possible array is 2 -2 0 0 hence the sum is 0.

Test Case 2: The Possible array is 1 0 0 hence sum is 1.

"}
DUM:
{"pcode":"DUM","pname":"Okoye and Strings","pstmt":"

Black-Panther is busy fighting Infinity War. So he assigned some work to Okoye(Kattapa). Okoye(Kattapa) is given string s of all lowercase alphabets. She has to perform two type of query on string.

Query are:

1 l r : Print (numbers of ouccurences of 'a')* 1 + (numbers of ouccurences of 'b')* 2 + (numbers of ouccurences of 'c')* 3 + ...... ....+ (numbers of ouccurences of 'z')* 26 in substring of s from l to r.

2 i j : swap i'th charactor of string with j'th charactor.

Note : All indices are one based.

","pinput":"

First line of input contains string s.

Second line contains Q which is numbers of querys. Next Q line contains three integers type of query followed by two integers.

 

","poutput":"

Print answers of each type 1 query in new line.<br/>

","pconstrains":"

|s| = length of string
1 ≤ |s| ≤ 100000
1 ≤ l ≤ r ≤ |s|
1 ≤ Q ≤ 100000
string contains only lowecase letters.

","tcin":"

abcdefghijk
4
1 1 11
1 1 5
2 1 6
1 1 5

","tcout":"

66
15
20

","explain":"

for first query substring="abcdefghijk" and answer is (1)* 1 + (1)* 2 + .... + (1)* 11 + (0)* 12 + ... + (0)* 26 = 66 second query substring="abcde" and answer is (1)* 1 + (1)* 2 + (1)* 3 + (1)* 4 + (1)* 5 + (0)* 6 + ... + (0)* 26 = 15 after third query string is "fbcdeaghijk" fourth query substring="fbcde" and answer is (0)* 1 + (1)* 2 + (1)* 3 + (1)* 4 + (1)* 5 + (1)* 6 + (0)* 7 + ... + (0)* 26 = 20

 
"}
FRAME:
{"pcode":"FRAME","pname":" Shuri and Network problem","pstmt":"

Shuri is very fond of computer network subject. She discovered a new technique for data transfer in Wakanda. The new technique is described below:
 
The whole data to be tranferred is divided into many frames. These frames are sent continuosly. Now each frame has a special property. The frist element of frame represents the size of frame followed by size-1 elements.
 
For Example The frame with bytes 2,4,3,6 is of following form
5 2 4 3 6. Here the size 5 is included as header of frame.
 
Now Black Panther came to her with some weird problem. He wanted to download data but he thought that he was having some data loss. So Shuri started noting the data at some point of time(not necessarily from starting) in the form of array.  
 
Since Shuri is not very good at coding she asked for your help. You have to count the maximum number of frames that were possible in this given array and also the number of missing elements of last frame(could be 0).
 
If number of frames are same in that case print minimum count of data Loss.

 

","pinput":"

The first line of input is T denoting number of test cases.
For each test cases the first line contains an integer n denoting the size of array.
The next line contains n integers a[i] denoting the elements of array.

 

","poutput":"

For each test case output two space separated integers x and y where x is number of maximum frames and y denoting number of missing data elements.

","pconstrains":"

T ≤ 10
1 ≤ n ≤ 10000
2 ≤ a[i] ≤ 100

","tcin":"
2
6
5 2 3 2 3 2
4
2 5 3 2
","tcout":"
4 1
2 1
","explain":"

Test case 1:  ...5)( **2** 3)( **2** 3)( **2** _ )So maximum numbers of frame is 4 and numbers of missing bytes are 1. Test caes 2: There are many ways to get maximum frames,
    1.  ( **2** 5)(**3** 2 _ ) Tatal frames are 2 and missing bytes in last frame are 1 So answer is 2 1.
    2.  ... 2)( **5** 3 2 _ _ ) Total frames are 2 and missing bytes in last frame are 2.
    3.  ... 2 5)( **3** 2 _ ) Total frames are 2 and missing bytes in last frame are 1.
    4.  ... 2 5 3)(**2** _ ) Total frames are 2 and missing bytes in last frame are 1.

"}
TOUR:
{"pcode":"TOUR","pname":"Black-Panther and Wakanda tour","pstmt":"

There are total N cities in wakanda numbered from 1 to N, Blanck-Panther is at city number one and he wants to go at last city. Each city has label of lowercase letter. He can only travel from city i to i+1 with some cost or any city j > i having same latter with zero cost. if he travel from city i to city j then cost will be absolute difference between ASCII of that two character. There are many possible paths from 1 to N. As his innovative sister is very busy, so he need your help to find minimum total cost to reach last city.

 
","pinput":"

The first line of the input contains an integer T denoting the number of test cases.

Next T lines contains string representing that i'th letter in string is label of city number i.

","poutput":"

Output should contain T lines. Each line denotes minimum total cost to reach last city.

","pconstrains":"

1 ≤ T ≤ 100
1 ≤ length of each string ≤ 100000

","tcin":"

2
abc
abcad

","tcout":"

2
3

","explain":"

In first case string is "abc" so possible paths from 'a'(city 1) to 'c'(city 3) is 1 -> 2 -> 3, cost = |'b' - 'a'| + |'c' - 'b'| = 2
In second case, one of the best path he can choose is 1 -> 4 -> 5 with cost 3.i.e. from 'a' to 'a' and then 'a'to 'd' so cost=|'a'-'a'|+|'d'-'a'|

"}
